question: I don't consider myself a very "fast" runner. Will I be left behind?
answer: Absolutely not. Our club is open to any runner of any ability. Our group runs are meant to be more casual and at a conversational pace. We do generally split off into natural pace groups depending on the size of the group. Also during group runs, we have several stops built in to allow everyone to catch up. We support anyone who likes running as a way of keeping healthy and fit.

question: When do you run?
answer: We meet several times a week at different locations around the area. Click [here](/#events) to learn about our upcoming runs.

question: Where do you typically run?
answer: Belmont Runners do hilly trail runs at local parks and flat road runs in Belmont, Redwood Shores, and other local running spots. We are always open to suggestions on great places to run and enjoy the mid-Peninsula.

question: What are the group runs like?
answer: On a beautiful Saturday morning you will typically find 15-20 runners. On a miserable, dark winter evening you might find 5-8 brave souls who will weather the rain/wind/humidity. In either case, we are a positive, social group that will brighten your day and help you keep connected with your local community.

question: What is the membership fee?
answer: Annual membership in Belmont Runners is $20. This also helps to cover the costs of running the club as a non-profit organization, managing the website, club membership in the Road Runners Club of America, providing general liability insurance that covers accidental medical events, and supporting the club’s programs and events.

question: May I try out running with your group before becoming a member?
answer: Yes! Join us for up to two runs. If you like us, we ask that you join our community of runners and participate in promoting health and fitness.

question: What are some of the benefits of joining Belmont Runners?
answer: First and foremost, you can be part of a local community of runners who enjoy social connections with other runners and can support your fitness goals. Access to free or heavily discounted workshops and events. Recent or planned events include a foam roller workshop for runners, yoga for runners, nutritional classes, and visits to local breweries. Members also get great discounts on registering for local races and have insurance coverage should they be injured during group events.

question: How do I get information about the club and its events?
answer: There are five ways. First, the club website ([belmontrunners.com](https://www.belmontrunners.com)) provides information about upcoming training runs. Second, our [Facebook page](https://www.facebook.com/belmontrunnersclub) includes general information and breaking news. Third, we have a [Facebook members-only group](https://www.facebook.com/groups/402959680279126) that provides pictures, more detailed information, and opportunities to communicate with other club members. Fourth, we have an [Instagram page](https://www.instagram.com/belmontrunners) with more content. Finally, we have a monthly newsletter that provides updates on our club.

question: Do you cancel your runs for wildfire smoke?
answer: We take our runner’s health very seriously. If the local Air Quality Index is over 80 we will call off our group runs. The closest official government reading can be found at the [BAAQMD](https://baaqmdmapsprod.azurewebsites.net/map-air-quality-home.html) website (check the Redwood City sensor). If you use a resource like [Purple Air](https://www.purpleair.com/map?opt=1/mAQI/a10/cC0#13.25/37.51397/-122.30054), don’t forget to apply the US EPA filter, and to turn off indoor sensors.

question: Do you cancel your group runs for heat?
answer: Yes, if temperatures are over 90°F (32°C) we will cancel our group runs. For runs over 80°F (26.6°C), we will advise our runners to take proper precautions (bring water, slow down paces, etc).

question: How do I get a Club Member Shirt?
answer: We place periodic group orders (2-3x a year) through CustomInk for the official performance fabric shirts. We also have a variety of club apparel available at our [online store](https://forms.gle/Gyphn2XyzEG9pkyK6).

question: Can my child join the club?
answer: Of course! For children between the ages of 13 and 17, create an account and pay the $10 youth membership fee. Children under 13 are welcome to join us as long as they are accompanied by a parent/guardian. For children under 13, there is no need to register an online account. Talk to a run leader or board member at the next run to sign the liability waiver for your child.

question: Can I bring my dog?
answer: Yes, as long as your dog is on a leash 100% of the time. Also, check the runs, some locations such as Crystal Springs Cross Country, or the Carlmont High School track won't allow dogs.

question: Do you have a Strava group?
answer: Yes we do. You can find us [here](https://www.strava.com/clubs/belmontrunners).

question: How can I get more information?
answer: If you have general questions, we have a chat on the bottom right of this page. You can email us at [info@belmontrunners.com](mailto:info@belmontrunners.com) and we can answer your questions.
